result.execSummary:
The defendant Immanuel Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • DC with motor vehicle. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Immanuel Smith in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Immanuel Smith in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:21 PM. Called 16CM12, 16CM43 and 16CM127. State - here for FPT on 16CM12 and 16CM43, 16CM127 is set for INIT. State - resolved 16CM12 and16CM43. Court - 16CM127 - Lynch has gone over complaint with the defendant, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts and sets for FPT. Lynch would like to be heard in regards to the cash bond on 16CM27 - bond - requests signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - 16CM127 - 16CM12 - amend #1 to county ordinace of DC with motor vehicle with $300 for plus costs and plead to #2 as alleged with court costs only, 16CM43 - pleas to as alleged with a $300.00 fine plus costs and #2 - DRI, eligible for expunction upon payment of fines if court orders. Lynch did also receive an offer for probation on 16CM127. Court - bond - 16CM127 - $1000 signature bond with no consumtpion of alcohol. Court sets 16CM127 for FPT. Court - 16CM12 - court amends count #1 to county ordinacne of DC with motor vehicle, pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $300 plus costs totalling $582.50 - 60 DTP/CO. 16CM12 - Smith pleads NC to count #2 as alleged. Court - 16CM43 - #2 - DRI, Smith pleads NC to count #1 as alleged. Lynch believes that was supposed to be amended to county ordinance of obstructing. State willing to amend that count to county ordinance of obstructing with a $300.00 forfeiture plus costs. Court - 16CM43 - amends count #1 to county ordinance of obstructing, pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50 - 120 DTP/CO. Court has plea questionnaire for count #2 on 16CM12, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Lynch makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for expunction un der 973.015. Smith withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CM12 - count #2 - court costs - 180 DTP/CO, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, expunge under 973.015 upon payment of fine in full, right to appeal.

releasing from jail.

Attorney Chad Lynch in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:49 AM. Called 16CM12 and 16CM43. Lynch not sure where the defendant is, has been playing phone tag with the defendant but has no update for the Court. State asks that any bond posted by forfeited and asks for bench warrant , body or $500.00 on each case. Lynch does give verbal objection to the forfeiture of any bond. Court will set for a bond forfeiture hearing.
State
defense
4/27/16 hearing
Final pre-trial on June 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Immanuel Smith in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:14 AM. Lynch informs Court that he will take over on both cases and Rielly will be taken off. Court allows Lynch to take over both cases and allows substitution of counsel. Lynch has both complaints, waives reading of both of them, enters NG pleas to all counts on both cases. Court continues bond on both cases, accepts pleas, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
No consumption of alcohol and no driving without a valid drivers license.

Defendant Immanuel Smith in court, in custody and apperas via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:54 AM. Called 16CM12 & 16CM43. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Smith understands charges and penalties, believes that Attorney Michael Rielly is assigned to 16CM12 and Attorney Chad Lynch is supposed to be on 16CM43. Court will give the defendant another date for both cases. Court quashes the warrant on 16CM12. Smith explains why he was not in court on the 6th. Court imposes a $500.00 signature bond on each case and instructed to contact SPD again and inform them that his attorney never showed today.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on April 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Arrested - sent email to JA for scheduling

Defendant Immanuel Smith not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:51 AM. Court puts on the record that the weather is not good today due to snow storm. State - no service on the defendant but still asks for bench warrant, body or $250.00. Court looks at file and it appears that the defense counsel is Michael Rielly. Court orders bench warrant, body or $250.00.
